description:
This module introduces cultural policy studies as a
distinct domain of cultural studies. It examines the
stakes involved in defining and operating within
cultural policy studies by analysing the practices of
cultural industries, art institutions, cultural planning
and participation, and creative economies. Students
will evaluate specific instances of cultural policy
development, and produce studies of cultural
practices in order to re-think perceived notions of
identity, representation and power. Students
completing the module will appreciate the
relationship between critical analysis and policy
orientation in cultural studies and be familiar with
specific instances of cultural policy development at
national and international levels.
title: Cultural Policy
